trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.Speech.AudioFormat"></xref> namespace consists of a single class, <xref href="System.Speech.AudioFormat.SpeechAudioFormatInfo"></xref>, which contains information about the format of the audio that is being input to the speech recognition engine, or being output from the speech synthesis engine.
You can use the properties of <xref:System.Speech.AudioFormat.SpeechAudioFormatInfo> to obtain information about specific characteristics of an audio format.
These properties are read-only, except for <xref:System.Speech.AudioFormat.SpeechAudioFormatInfo.BlockAlign%2A>, which you can use to set the block alignment of incoming audio.
To get all the properties of the incoming audio format, use the <xref:System.Speech.AudioFormat.SpeechAudioFormatInfo.FormatSpecificData%2A> method.
Using the constructors on the <xref:System.Speech.AudioFormat.SpeechAudioFormatInfo> class, you can specify any of the properties of the audio format when you initialize the object.
